segments.text: I see the open window, and it’s so peaceful outside compared to the chaos in here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden looks so calm and tidy, but the kitchen is a complete mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman would rather be out there instead of dealing with this disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light coming through the window is so bright, but no one is paying attention to it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the contrast between the outside and inside is almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The curtains are tied back, and it’s like the outside world is just watching this madness unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how normal everything looks from the window, but it’s pure chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The path in the garden is so straight and neat, but the kitchen is anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman ever looks out there and wishes she could escape.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The bushes outside are so well-kept, but the kitchen is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is like a metaphor for something, but I’m not sure what.
segments.speaker: PAR
